dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, let's talk about what's been happening in Washington D.C. The sixth night of protests there, man, it just went from peaceful to, like, really turbulent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, let's talk about what's been happening in Washington D C. The sixth night of protests there, man, it just went from peaceful to, like, really turbulent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The sixth night of protests in Washington, D.C., sparked by the death of George Floyd, went from peaceful to turbulent...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it really did. I mean, the lights illuminating the U.S. Capitol actually went dark. And then, uh, the White House lights went out around 11 p.m. too, which is just wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it really did. I mean, the lights illuminating the U S Capitol actually went dark. And then, uh, the White House lights went out around eleven p.m. too, which is just wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Washington, D.C. saw the lights illuminating the White House go out sometime around 11 p.m. EST...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And then you had looters, like, taking goods from shops – Sephora, Nike, CVS, Target... even grocery stores. People were using baseball bats to smash glass.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And then you had looters, like, taking goods from shops - Sephora, Nike, C V S, Target... even grocery stores. People were using baseball bats to smash glass.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Grocery stores were looted around the capitol, along with a Sephora, a Nike store, a CVS drugstore, a Target and a local liquor store, with protesters using baseball bats to smash glass to gain access to goods.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, it was, it was crazy. And then fires were set too. Even, uh, in the basement of the historic St. John's Church. Just, uh, an intense night all around.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, it was, it was crazy. And then fires were set too. Even, uh, in the basement of the historic St. John's Church. Just, uh, an intense night all around.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fires were set across the city, according to earlier reports, including in the basement of the historic St. Johns Church.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And through all this, President Trump, like, largely remained out of public sight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And through all this, President Trump, like, largely remained out of public sight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...as President Trump remained out of public sight.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I heard reports that he was even taken to an underground bunker as a precaution on Friday night. Pretty, pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I heard reports that he was even taken to an underground bunker as a precaution on Friday night. Pretty, pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Reports say Trump was taken to an underground White House bunker as a precaution during Friday nights protests in the capitol.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] A bunker! But he did, you know, eventually tweet 'LAW AND ORDER!' on Sunday night.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A bunker! But he did, you know, eventually tweet L A W A N D O R D E R! on Sunday night.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He has, however, tweeted about the protests, proclaiming LAW AND ORDER! around 7 p.m. EST Sunday night...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He did, yeah. Along with a claim that the National Guard, uh, stopped protesters cold in Minneapolis. Which, you know, is a whole other thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He did, yeah. Along with a claim that the National Guard, uh, stopped protesters cold in Minneapolis. Which, you know, is a whole other thing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...along with a claim that the National Guard stopped protesters cold in Minneapolis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And the National Guard has been activated in so many states now, like, 15 states plus D.C.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And the National Guard has been activated in so many states now, like, fifteen states plus D C.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ABC News reported that the National Guard has been activated in 21 states plus Washington, D.C.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the numbers are just, uh, staggering. Over 2,500 people arrested nationwide over the weekend in connection to these protests.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the numbers are just, uh, staggering. Over two thousand, five hundred people arrested nationwide over the weekend in connection to these protests.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 2,564. Thats how many people were arrested over the weekend in connection to protests around the country, according to the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's a huge number. And obviously, this all stems from, like, the death of George Floyd, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a huge number. And obviously, this all stems from, like, the death of George Floyd, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The sixth night of protests in Washington, D.C., sparked by the death of George Floyd...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. That video of the Minneapolis police officer, uh, Derek Chauvin, kneeling on Floyd's neck, it just sparked outrage across the country.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. That video of the Minneapolis police officer, uh, Derek Chauvin, kneeling on Floyd's neck, it just sparked outrage across the country.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Frustrations with police brutality towards black people boiled over after a video of a white Minneapolis police officer kneeling on Floyds neck⁠with three other officers standing by⁠went viral.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And it's all happening, you know, amid a pandemic and mass unemployment. It's just, uh, a really volatile situation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's all happening, you know, amid a pandemic and mass unemployment. It's just, uh, a really volatile situation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The death of George Floyd sparked nationwide outrage, coming amid the coronavirus pandemic and mass unemployment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And Chauvin, he's been arrested, charged with third-degree murder, but the family and the chief are saying that charge needs to be upgraded.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And Chauvin, he's been arrested, charged with third-degree murder, but the family and the chief are saying that charge needs to be upgraded.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The officer captured in the video, Derek Chauvin, has been arrested, charged with third-degree murder... Floyds family have called for Chauvins charge to be upgraded to first-degree murder, while the Minneapolis police chief has said Chauvin, along with the three other officers seen in the video, bear responsibility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they're pushing for first-degree. It's still developing, but, uh, a heavy situation for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they're pushing for first-degree. It's still developing, but, uh, a heavy situation for sure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Floyds family have called for Chauvins charge to be upgraded to first-degree murder...
